text: Frederick Elphinstone Brown (30 January 1896 – 18 December 1971) was an Australian rules footballer who played with in the Victorian Football League (VFL). Prior to his football career Brown enlisted to serve in World War I in February 1917, seeing action in France before returning to Australia in 1919. After playing with Caulfield Football Club, Brown joined Hawthorn at the start of the 1922 VFA season and he played in Hawthorn's first two seasons in the VFL. == Notes == == External links == * * Category:1896 births Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:Hawthorn Football Club players Category:Hawthorn Football Club (VFA) players Category:1971 deaths
title: Fred Brown (Australian footballer)
